snippet: South Korean soccer player Park Jong-woo was barred from receiving his bronze medal on Saturday for displaying a sign with a political message after his team’s victory in the third-place game.
abstract: South Korean soccer player Park Jong-soo is barred from receiving his bronze medal at the London Olympics for displaying a sign with a political message after a victory over Japan in the third-place game; he held up a sign claiming South Korean sovereignty over Dokdo, a set of barely inhabitable islands that are also claimed by Japan.
lead_paragraph: South Korean soccer player Park Jong-woo was barred from receiving his bronze medal on Saturday for displaying a sign with a political message after his team’s victory in the third-place game.

headline.seo: Medal Denied to South Korean Soccer Player Over Political Sign
headline.main: South Korean Denied Medal Over Politics
headline.print_headline: South Korean Denied Medal Over Politics
